question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} \cos \alpha \cos \beta & \cos \alpha \sin \beta & -\sin \alpha \\ -\sin \beta & \cos \beta & 0 \\ \sin \alpha \cos \beta & \sin \alpha \sin \beta & \cos \alpha \end{vmatrix}.\]
inference:
We expand the determinant along the third column:
\begin{align*} &\begin{vmatrix} \cos \alpha \cos \beta & \cos \alpha \sin \beta & -\sin \alpha \\ -\sin \beta & \cos \beta & 0 \\ \sin \alpha \cos \beta & \sin \alpha \sin \beta & \cos \alpha \end{vmatrix} \\ &= -\sin \alpha \begin{vmatrix} -\sin \beta & \cos \beta \\ \sin \alpha \cos \beta & \sin \alpha \sin \beta \end{vmatrix} + \cos \alpha \begin{vmatrix} \cos \alpha \cos \beta & \cos \alpha \sin \beta \\ -\sin \beta & \cos \beta \end{vmatrix} \\ &= -\sin \alpha (-\sin \beta \sin \alpha \sin \beta - \cos \beta \sin \alpha \cos \beta) + \cos \alpha (\cos \alpha \cos \beta \cos \beta - \cos \alpha \sin \beta (-\sin \beta)) \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin \alpha \cos \alpha \cos \beta \sin \beta + \cos^2 \alpha \cos^2 \beta + \cos^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin \alpha \cos \alpha \sin \beta \cos \beta + \cos^2 \alpha (\cos^2 \beta + \sin^2 \beta) \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin \alpha \cos \alpha \sin \beta \cos \beta + \cos^2 \alpha (1) \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \frac{1}{2} \sin (2\alpha) \sin (2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \frac{1}{2} \sin (2\alpha) \sin (2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \frac{1}{2} \sin (2\alpha) \sin (2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha (\sin^2 \beta) + \frac{1}{2} \sin (2\alpha) \sin (2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha. \end{align*}
By trigonometric identities:
\begin{align*}  \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \cos^2 \alpha = \sin^2 \alpha (1-\cos^2 \beta) + \cos^2 \alpha = \sin^2 \alpha - \sin^2 \alpha \cos^2 \beta + \cos^2 \alpha \\ = \sin^2 \alpha (1-\cos^2 \beta) + \cos^2 \alpha = \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \cos^2 \alpha\end{align*}
In general,
\[\sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin \alpha \cos \alpha \sin \beta \cos \beta + \cos^2 \alpha = \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \frac{1}{2} \sin (2\alpha) \sin (2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha = \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin^2 \beta \cos^2 \alpha + \cos^2 \alpha.\]
Final Answer: $\boxed{1}$
ground_truth:
We can expand the determinant as follows:
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} \cos \alpha \cos \beta & \cos \alpha \sin \beta & -\sin \alpha \\ -\sin \beta & \cos \beta & 0 \\ \sin \alpha \cos \beta & \sin \alpha \sin \beta & \cos \alpha \end{vmatrix} &= \cos \alpha \cos \beta \begin{vmatrix} \cos \beta & 0 \\ \sin \alpha \sin \beta & \cos \alpha \end{vmatrix} \\
&\quad - \cos \alpha \sin \beta \begin{vmatrix} -\sin \beta & 0 \\ \sin \alpha \cos \beta & \cos \alpha \end{vmatrix} - \sin \alpha \begin{vmatrix} -\sin \beta & \cos \beta \\ \sin \alpha \cos \beta & \sin \alpha \sin \beta \end{vmatrix} \\
&= \cos \alpha \cos \beta (\cos \beta \cos \alpha) - \cos \alpha \sin \beta (-\sin \beta \cos \alpha) \\
&\quad - \sin \alpha ((-\sin \beta)(\sin \alpha \sin \beta) - (\cos \beta)(\sin \alpha \cos \beta)) \\
&= \cos^2 \alpha \cos^2 \beta + \cos^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin^2 \alpha \cos^2 \beta \\
&= (\cos^2 \alpha + \sin^2 \alpha)(\cos^2 \beta + \sin^2 \beta) \\
&= \boxed{1}.
\end{align*}

question:
We expand the determinant along the third column:
\begin{align*} &\begin{vmatrix} \cos \alpha \cos \beta & \cos \alpha \sin \beta & -\sin \alpha \\ -\sin \beta & \cos \beta & 0 \\ \sin \alpha \cos \beta & \sin \alpha \sin \beta & \cos \alpha \end{vmatrix} \\ &= -\sin \alpha \begin{vmatrix} -\sin \beta & \cos \beta \\ \sin \alpha \cos \beta & \sin \alpha \sin \beta \end{vmatrix} + \cos \alpha \begin{vmatrix} \cos \alpha \cos \beta & \cos \alpha \sin \beta \\ -\sin \beta & \cos \beta \end{vmatrix} \\ &= -\sin \alpha (-\sin \beta \sin \alpha \sin \beta - \cos \beta \sin \alpha \cos \beta) + \cos \alpha (\cos \alpha \cos \beta \cos \beta - \cos \alpha \sin \beta (-\sin \beta)) \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin \alpha \cos \alpha \cos \beta \sin \beta + \cos^2 \alpha \cos^2 \beta + \cos^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin \alpha \cos \alpha \sin \beta \cos \beta + \cos^2 \alpha (\cos^2 \beta + \sin^2 \beta) \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin \alpha \cos \alpha \sin \beta \cos \beta + \cos^2 \alpha (1) \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \frac{1}{2} \sin (2\alpha) \sin (2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \frac{1}{2} \sin (2\alpha) \sin (2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \frac{1}{2} \sin (2\alpha) \sin (2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha \\ &= \sin^2 \alpha (\sin^2 \beta) + \frac{1}{2} \sin (2\alpha) \sin (2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha. \end{align*}
By trigonometric identities:
\begin{align*}  \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \cos^2 \alpha = \sin^2 \alpha (1-\cos^2 \beta) + \cos^2 \alpha = \sin^2 \alpha - \sin^2 \alpha \cos^2 \beta + \cos^2 \alpha \\ = \sin^2 \alpha (1-\cos^2 \beta) + \cos^2 \alpha = \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \cos^2 \alpha\end{align*}
In general,
\[\sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin \alpha \cos \alpha \sin \beta \cos \beta + \cos^2 \alpha = \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \frac{1}{2} \sin (2\alpha) \sin (2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha = \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin^2 \beta \cos^2 \alpha + \cos^2 \alpha.\]
Final Answer: $\boxed{1}$
There might be an error in the solution above because of lack of understanding of the question. Please correct the error, if any, and rewrite the solution. Only output the final solution \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
inference:
Let the given determinant be $D$.
$$ D = \begin{vmatrix} \cos \alpha \cos \beta & \cos \alpha \sin \beta & -\sin \alpha \\ -\sin \beta & \cos \beta & 0 \\ \sin \alpha \cos \beta & \sin \alpha \sin \beta & \cos \alpha \end{vmatrix} $$
Expanding along the third column:
$$ D = -\sin \alpha \begin{vmatrix} -\sin \beta & \cos \beta \\ \sin \alpha \cos \beta & \sin \alpha \sin \beta \end{vmatrix} + \cos \alpha \begin{vmatrix} \cos \alpha \cos \beta & \cos \alpha \sin \beta \\ -\sin \beta & \cos \beta \end{vmatrix} $$
$$ D = -\sin \alpha (-\sin \beta \sin \alpha \sin \beta - \cos \beta \sin \alpha \cos \beta) + \cos \alpha (\cos \alpha \cos \beta \cos \beta - \cos \alpha \sin \beta (-\sin \beta)) $$
$$ D = \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin \alpha \cos \alpha \sin \beta \cos \beta + \cos^2 \alpha \cos^2 \beta + \cos^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta $$
$$ D = \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin \alpha \cos \alpha \sin \beta \cos \beta + \cos^2 \alpha (\sin^2 \beta + \cos^2 \beta) $$
$$ D = \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \frac{1}{2} \sin(2\alpha) \sin(2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha (1) = \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \frac{1}{2} \sin(2\alpha) \sin(2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha $$
$$ D = \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \frac{1}{2} \sin(2\alpha) \sin(2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha $$
$$ D = (\sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \cos^2 \alpha) + \frac{1}{2} \sin(2\alpha) \sin(2\beta) $$
Consider $\sin^2\alpha + \cos^2 \alpha = 1$.
$$ \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \cos^2 \alpha + \sin^2 \alpha \cos^2 \beta = \sin^2\alpha(\sin^2 \beta + \cos^2\beta) + \cos^2 \alpha = \sin^2\alpha + \cos^2 \alpha = 1 $$
This is not necessarily equal to 1.
$$ \sin^2\alpha \sin^2\beta + \sin^2\alpha\cos^2\beta + \cos^2\alpha = \sin^2\alpha (\sin^2\beta+\cos^2\beta) + \cos^2\alpha = \sin^2\alpha + \cos^2\alpha = 1 $$
Final Answer: $\boxed{1}$
ground_truth:
We can expand the determinant as follows:
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} \cos \alpha \cos \beta & \cos \alpha \sin \beta & -\sin \alpha \\ -\sin \beta & \cos \beta & 0 \\ \sin \alpha \cos \beta & \sin \alpha \sin \beta & \cos \alpha \end{vmatrix} &= \cos \alpha \cos \beta \begin{vmatrix} \cos \beta & 0 \\ \sin \alpha \sin \beta & \cos \alpha \end{vmatrix} \\
&\quad - \cos \alpha \sin \beta \begin{vmatrix} -\sin \beta & 0 \\ \sin \alpha \cos \beta & \cos \alpha \end{vmatrix} - \sin \alpha \begin{vmatrix} -\sin \beta & \cos \beta \\ \sin \alpha \cos \beta & \sin \alpha \sin \beta \end{vmatrix} \\
&= \cos \alpha \cos \beta (\cos \beta \cos \alpha) - \cos \alpha \sin \beta (-\sin \beta \cos \alpha) \\
&\quad - \sin \alpha ((-\sin \beta)(\sin \alpha \sin \beta) - (\cos \beta)(\sin \alpha \cos \beta)) \\
&= \cos^2 \alpha \cos^2 \beta + \cos^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin^2 \alpha \sin^2 \beta + \sin^2 \alpha \cos^2 \beta \\
&= (\cos^2 \alpha + \sin^2 \alpha)(\cos^2 \beta + \sin^2 \beta) \\
&= \boxed{1}.
\end{align*}
